gsocideas.Add 'Reverted' filter to RC Filters:
The [RecentChanges page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChanges)
contains a list of recent changes to Wikipedia. It would be valuable to be
able to filter out or highlight edits that have already been "rolled back" or
"undone". This can be a huge improvement for using Recent Changes as a review
tool, reducing the effect of stepping onto other reviewers feet (reducing
frustration and saving time). This project will involve tagging edits that
have been reverted with a "reverted" tag, and then expanding on the tooling
([phab:T152434](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T152434 "phab:T152434")) to
improve revert detection.

**More details:** [phab:T164307](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T164307
"phab:T164307")

**Skills required:** Requires knowledge of PHP.

**Mentors:** [Kosta Harlan](/wiki/User:KHarlan_\(WMF\) "User:KHarlan
\(WMF\)"), [Roan Kattouw](/wiki/User:Catrope "User:Catrope")
gsocideas.Add leaderboard based on user's edits us:
The Wikimedia Commons Android app allows users to upload pictures from their
Android phone/tablet to Wikimedia Commons. Commons is not only the image
repository for Wikipedia, but an independent project that seeks to document
the world with photos, videos and recordings. This project is about adding a
leaderboard based on user's edits using Commons. The feature will include only
edits made with the mobile app, and users who have shown interest in this
activity.

**More details:** [phab:T244197](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T244197
"phab:T244197")

**Skills required:** Android SDK, Android UI design, Understanding of RxJava,
Basic knowledge of Wikimedia APIs

**Mentors:** [Vivek Maskara](/wiki/User:Maskaravivek "User:Maskaravivek"),
[Nicolas Raoul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:Syced "en:User:Syced")
gsocideas.Create or improve a tool for monitoring:
databases

Wikimedia uses over 200 MariaDB instances to store content and metadata for
Wikipedia and other free knowledge projects. While standard open source tools
for both monitoring and automation are used when possible, there are some
tasks that require custom development. There are 2 options for a project to
choose here:

1\. Proof of concept of a web-based dashboard that will be used for inventory
and/or summary of the status of the MariaDB fleet. While there is already an
existing tool, [Tendril](https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/Tendril
"wikitech:Tendril"), it has degraded over time and doesn't take advantage of
(or integrate with) modern technologies available at Wikimedia such as
[prometheus+grafana metrics monitoring](https://grafana.wikimedia.org),
[performance_schema](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T195578), [pt-
heartbeat](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T111266), or our [database backup
system](https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/MariaDB/Backups
"wikitech:MariaDB/Backups"). There is also the need of a d3-based (javascript)
replacement for <https://dbtree.wikimedia.org>.

2\. Small-scope command line utilities to perform maintenance and monitoring
tasks, such as: [data checks between
servers](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/diffusion/OSMD/browse/master/wmfmariadbpy/compare.py?blame=off),
[data
transfers](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/diffusion/OSMD/browse/master/wmfmariadbpy/transfer.py?blame=off),
consistency checks between data and metadata, strange MariaDB process
monitoring, and more. Integration of existing libraries and tools should be
preferred when possible, rather than custom solutions, as well as focusing on
future extensibility and maintainability rather than a large scope.

**Skills required:** Python (preferred) or PHP, SQL

**More details:** 077323177

  
</noinclude>[task T246435](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T246435
"phabricator:T246435")

**Mentors:** [Jaime
Crespo](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:JCrespo_\(WMF\)
"meta:User:JCrespo \(WMF\)") aka #jynus, [Manuel
Arostegui](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:MArostegui_\(WMF\)
"meta:User:MArostegui \(WMF\)")
gsocideas.Design and Develop a tool to correct fal:
Wikimedia Commons

A significant part of structured data has been entered through other
applications(tools) which have been developed to collect structured data for
the images on Commons. Though this is a fast way to collect structured data,
we realized that in tools like ISA, where campaigns are organized and the
participants will have prizes as top contributors, this may push some
participants to enter ‘wrong’ or ‘unclear’ information which needs to be
verified. In this project we try to build a tool which volunteers/admins will
use to verify the structured data which have been added.

**More details:** [phab:T245758](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T245758
"phab:T245758")

**Skills required:** Python,Javascript and related libraries,HTML/CSS,SQL

**Mentors:** [Eugene Egbe](/wiki/User:Eugene233 "User:Eugene233"), [Navino
Evans](/wiki/User:NavinoEvans "User:NavinoEvans")
gsocideas.Develop a mechanism to send Wikimedia-sp:
New contributors find their way to Wikimedia's Zulip chat quite frequently. It
is also used for GSoC, Outreachy and GSoD discussions. One of the first
questions they usually ask is information on getting started. The answer seems
to be fairly consistent -- pointing them to some beginner resources. In this
project, we try to develop a mechanism to automate this process.

**More details:** [phab:T233478](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T233478
"phab:T233478")

**Skills required:** Python3 (+ any Python framework), JavaScript (+ any JS
framework) and Linux Administration (for Toolforge)

**Mentors:** [Pavithra Eswaramoorthy](/wiki/User:Pavithraes
"User:Pavithraes"), [Derick Alangi](/wiki/User:X-Savitar "User:X-Savitar"),
[Medha Bansal](/wiki/User:Medhabansal "User:Medhabansal")
gsocideas.Develop an editing widget for Proofread:
The [pagelist](https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Help:Index_pages#pagelist
"wikisource:Help:Index pages") creation process supported by the
[Extension:Proofread Page](/wiki/Extension:Proofread_Page "Extension:Proofread
Page"), in its current shape and form, is difficult for new users, and not
particularly fast for experienced users. This project is about developing a
new editing widget for it, so it can be edited more easily without relying on
external applications.

**More details:** [phab:T172953](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T172953
"phab:T172953")

**Skills required:** Familiarity with PHP & JavaScript

**Mentors:** [Sam Wilson](/wiki/User:SWilson_\(WMF\) "User:SWilson \(WMF\)"),
[Satdeep Gill](https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:SGill_\(WMF\)
"metawiki:User:SGill \(WMF\)")
gsocideas.Evaluate WebdriverIO replacements for ou:
We use WebdriverIO as a browser driver for our test automation framework.
There are at least a couple of good alternatives. Evaluate how much work would
it be to switch to an alternative.

**More details:** [phab:T247835](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T247835
"phab:T247835")

**Skills required:** JavaScript/Node.js

**Mentors:** [Jose Gabriel Pita](/wiki/User:JPita_\(WMF\) "User:JPita
\(WMF\)"), [Željko Filipin](/wiki/User:ZFilipin_\(WMF\) "User:ZFilipin
\(WMF\)")
gsocideas.Improve Wiki Education Dashboard javascr:
bundle size

The [Wiki Education
Dashboard](https://github.com/WikiEducationFoundation/WikiEduDashboard) is a
Ruby on Rails + React app that runs
[dashboard.wikiedu.org](https://dashboard.wikiedu.org) as well as
[outreachdashboard.wmflabs.org](https://outreachdashboard.wmflabs.org). The
app has a JavaScript frontend built mostly in React, but it's evolved
gradually over the last several years, through a number of trends in
JavaScript frontend technology. The build uses both `gulp` and `webpack`, and
there are a number of libraries — including jquery — that should be updated or
in some cases removed. The focus of this project will be to improve the
Dashboard's build tooling.

**More details:** [phab:T244427](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T244427
"phab:T244427")

**Skills required:** Requires knowledge of JavaScript; experience with React
and with configuring and using Webpack will be very beneficial. Knowledge of
Ruby and Rails will be helpful, but not necessary.

**Mentors:** [Sage Ross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:Ragesoss
"en:User:Ragesoss"), TBA
gsocideas.Improve Wiki Education Dashboard's error:
The [Wiki Education
Dashboard](https://github.com/WikiEducationFoundation/WikiEduDashboard) is a
Ruby on Rails + React app that runs
[dashboard.wikiedu.org](https://dashboard.wikiedu.org) as well as
[outreachdashboard.wmflabs.org](https://outreachdashboard.wmflabs.org). For
this project, you'll develop a system for capturing and surfacing errors in
the course update process, so that it's easy for users to find out what went
wrong with their particular course when data-related errors occur. This will
involve capturing data about such errors when they occur, saving it in
association with a particular course, and displaying that information in an
appropriate way to Dashboard program leaders and admins.

**More details:** [phab:T244428](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T244428
"phab:T244428")

**Skills required:** Requires knowledge of Ruby and Rails, experience with
JavaScript, and particularly React, will be helpful.

**Mentors:** [Sage Ross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:Ragesoss
"en:User:Ragesoss"), TBA
gsocideas.Internet in a Box Enhancement:
Internet in a Box (IIAB) is a platform to provide offline access to Wikimedia
Foundation wikis and other content and applications. It is used by Wiki-
Project Med as an information appliance for Healthcare Providers. This project
involves implementing some technical enhancements to IIAB.

**More details:** [phab:T242997](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T242997
"phab:T242997")

**Skills required:** TBD

**Mentors:** [ Tim-moody](/wiki/User:Tim-moody "User:Tim-moody"), [Pratyush
Singhal](/wiki/User:Psinghal20 "User:Psinghal20")
gsocideas.Remove use of jQuery UI from Page Forms:
jQuery UI is a library that was added to MediaWiki in version 1.16, in 2010,
at the same time as its "sister" library, jQuery. jQuery remains popular (and
extremely useful), but jQuery UI is not popular, at least among MediaWiki
developers. This project involves removing the use of jQuery UI from [ Page
Forms](/wiki/Extension:Page_Forms "Extension:Page Forms") \- A MediaWiki
extension that allows users to add, edit and query data using forms.

**More details:** [phab:T241632](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T241632
"phab:T241632")

**Skills required:** PHP, JavaScript

**Mentors:** Yaron Koren, TBD
gsocideas.Support 'maps' parameter in TemplateData:
[ TemplateData](/wiki/Extension:TemplateData "Extension:TemplateData") is a
MediaWiki extension that introduces a <templatedata> tag and an API which
together allow editors to specify how templates should be invoked. This
project involves supporting the 'maps' parameter in the [TemplateData
Editor](/wiki/Help:TemplateData#TemplateData_editor "Help:TemplateData")
directly. Currently, it is only possible in source editing mode. The maps
parameter is used by [citoid](/wiki/Citoid "Citoid") and other third-party
gadgets, and supporting it would be a good addition.

**More details:** [phab:T208305](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T208305
"phab:T208305")

**Skills required:** JavaScript

**Mentors:** [Marielle Volz](/wiki/User:Mvolz_\(WMF\) "User:Mvolz \(WMF\)"),
[Thalia Chan](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/p/Tchanders/
"phab:p/Tchanders/"), [Moriel Schottlender](/wiki/User:Mooeypoo
"User:Mooeypoo") _(only available for answering high-level questions related
to the codebase)_
gsocideas.Upgrade WebdriverIO to the latest versio:
We use WebdriverIO as a browser driver for our test automation framework. We
are currently using version 4. Version 5 was released more than a year ago.
Version 6 will be release any day now.

**More details:** [phab:T247844](https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T247844
"phab:T247844")

**Skills required:** JavaScript/Node.js

**Mentors:** [John Bolorinos](/wiki/User:JBolorinos_\(WMF\) "User:JBolorinos
\(WMF\)"), [Željko Filipin](/wiki/User:ZFilipin_\(WMF\) "User:ZFilipin
\(WMF\)")
